summary: A letter from Kirkland & Ellis LLP to the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the Epstein non-prosecution agreement, objecting to misstatements in victim notification procedures, disputing the role of the attorney representative, and seeking clarification on the list of victims and civil restitution responsibilities.

persons.name: Josefsberg
persons.context: Mentioned as the attorney representative for victims in the Epstein case; the letter disputes his duties and prior work without notification to Epstein's defense team.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as Mr. Epstein; the letter discusses his responsibilities under the non-prosecution agreement and objections to victim notification procedures.

persons.name: Jay P. Lellzowitz
persons.context: Appears as the sender of the fax transmittal on August 22, 2009, indicating he is likely the author or responsible attorney for the correspondence.

connections.description: Josefsberg is the attorney representative for victims in Epstein's case; Epstein's counsel disputes his duties and prior work without notification.
Lellzowitz, from Kirkland & Ellis LLP, is communicating on behalf of Epstein's defense team regarding the non-prosecution agreement.

events.title: Josefsberg's preparation as attorney representative
events.description: Mr. Josefsberg expended time, effort, and funds in preparing to serve as attorney representative for victims in October 2007, which Epstein's defense claims they were not notified of.

events.title: Memorialization of victim list
events.description: The government memorialized a list of individuals as of September 24, 2007, which was disclosed to Epstein on June 30, 2005, per the agreement's requirements.

events.title: Disclosure of victim list to Epstein
events.description: The list of individuals was disclosed to Mr. Epstein on June 30, 2005, the date of sentence pursuant to the non-prosecution agreement's disclosure requirements.

keyFacts: Epstein's defense team objects to misstatements in the U.S. Attorney's victim notification letter and draft notification dated August 21, 2008.
The defense disputes that any judge ordered the U.S. to provide a copy of the non-prosecution agreement to alleged victims, citing confidentiality conflicts.
The letter seeks confirmation that the victim list finalized as of September 24, 2007, and disclosed on June 30, 2005, will not be expanded.
Epstein's counsel argues that the attorney representative (Josefsberg) should not engage in contested litigation and that his duties need clarification.
The correspondence highlights ongoing negotiations over civil restitution under 18 U.S.C. ยง 2253 and the implementation of the non-prosecution agreement.
